alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 5:22AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Louis, northeastern Carlton and northwestern Douglas Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 522 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Thomson, to 6 miles south of Oliver, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Proctor, Oliver and South Range around 530 AM CDT. Superior, Hermantown, Wisconsin Point and Pike Lake Near Duluth around 535 AM CDT. City of Rice Lake, French River and Island Lake around 545 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Cody, Park Point, Billings Park, Gary New Duluth, Morgan Park, Palmers, Lakeside-Lester Park, Spirit Valley, Central Hillside and Jay Cooke State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
